de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractMaterialDialogFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • android.support.v4.app.DialogFragment
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.DialogInterface, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, Dialog, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractHeaderDialogFragment

    public abstract class AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
extends android.support.v4.app.DialogFragment
implements MaterialDialog
    An abstract base class for all dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and are able to show fragments.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      • setOnCancelListener

        public final void setOnCancelListener(@Nullable
                                      android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: MaterialDialog
        Sets the listener, which should be notified, when the dialog is canceled. Even in a cancelable dialog, the dialog may be dismissed for reasons other than being canceled or one of the supplied choices being selected. If you are interested in listening for all cases where the dialog is dismissed and not just when it is canceled, see setOnDismissListener.
        Specified by:
        setOnCancelListener in interface MaterialDialog
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be set, as an instance of the type DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, or null, if no listener should be set
        See Also:
        MaterialDialog.setCancelable(boolean), MaterialDialog.setOnDismissListener(android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener)

      • getWindowBackground

        public final android.graphics.drawable.Drawable getWindowBackground()
        Description copied from interface: MaterialDialogDecorator
        Returns the background of the dialog's window.
        Specified by:
        getWindowBackground in interface MaterialDialogDecorator
        Returns:
        The background of the dialog's window as an instance of the class Drawable or null, if no window background is set

      • setWindowBackground

        public final void setWindowBackground(@DrawableRes
                                      int resourceId)
        Description copied from interface: MaterialDialogDecorator
        Sets the background of the dialog's window. Preferably, it should be a 9-patch drawable using the color white for visible areas and transparency for invisible ones. This allows to customize the shape of the dialog as well as its shadow. The window background is only used if the dialog is not shown fullscreen. The drawable's padding is taken into account for insetting the dialog's content (see MaterialDialogDecorator.getWindowInsetLeft(), MaterialDialogDecorator.getWindowInsetTop(), MaterialDialogDecorator.getWindowInsetRight() and MaterialDialogDecorator.getWindowInsetBottom()).
        Specified by:
        setWindowBackground in interface MaterialDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        resourceId - The resource id of the window background, which should be set, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid drawable resource

      • setWindowBackground

        public final void setWindowBackground(@Nullable
                                      android.graphics.Bitmap windowBackground)
        Description copied from interface: MaterialDialogDecorator
        Sets the background of the dialog's window. The given bitmap is stretched to fit the dialog's width and height. Therefore, if the width and height is not explicitly given, the method MaterialDialogDecorator.setWindowBackground(int) should be preferred. If the given bitmap is null, a rectangle, which matches the width and height of the dialog, is used as the window background.
        Specified by:
        setWindowBackground in interface MaterialDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        windowBackground - The window background, which should be set, as an instance of the class Bitmap or null, if no window background should be set

      • getWindowInsetLeft

        public final int getWindowInsetLeft()
        Description copied from interface: MaterialDialogDecorator
        Returns the left inset of the dialog's content, depending on the padding of the dialog's window background. If the dialog is shown fullscreen, the inset is always 0.
        Specified by:
        getWindowInsetLeft in interface MaterialDialogDecorator
        Returns:
        The left inset of the dialog's content in pixels as an Integer value
